So this works
sess.run(tf.pow(2., 2))

but this doesn't
sess.run(tf.pow(2, 2.))

apply_op_def has logic to promote Python objects to shared type T but it doesn't always work. Perhaps type promotion should be done in a deeper layer in runtime, so that it also applies to Tensor values

body:
So this works
`sess.run(tf.pow(2., 2))`

but this doesn't
`sess.run(tf.pow(2, 2.))`

`apply_op_def` has logic to promote Python objects to shared type T but it doesn't always work. Perhaps type promotion should be done in a deeper layer in runtime, so that it also applies to Tensor values
